tagline: Full-pipeline data generalist — from ETL and analytics through ML, LLMs, computer vision, and NLP to MLOps
pros: Covers the full data-to-deployment pipeline — data engineering, modeling, serving, and monitoring
Grounds every ML project in data quality and simple baselines before reaching for complexity
Bridges technical ML work and business communication — explains model impact in terms stakeholders understand
Practical experience across classical ML, deep learning, LLMs, computer vision, and NLP
cons: Won't match a dedicated ML researcher's depth on novel architectures or cutting-edge techniques
Breadth across data disciplines means less expertise in niche areas like reinforcement learning or advanced time-series forecasting
Data-first approach can feel slow to teams eager to jump straight to modeling

model_recommendations.notes: Complex reasoning, architecture, security, or financial analysis. Needs the best available model with full thinking/reasoning enabled.
